definition: change of appearance/to revise one's point of view
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook

sentences.english: This great victory changed the complexion of the war .
sentences.chinese: 這次大捷使這戰爭改觀。

sentences.english: The manner to father had Chen Sanchuan to change gradually.
sentences.chinese: 陳三川對父親的態度漸漸有了改觀。

sentences.english: A fresh coat of paint transformed the room.
sentences.chinese: 房間粉刷一遍大爲改觀。

sentences.english: Joan sprained foot of all assistance, whole change, rental cottage to all the tiantai.
sentences.chinese: 瓊扭傷腳得全協助，對全改觀，出租天台小屋給全。

sentences.english: No matter what you do, your view of an oversharer is forever changed。
sentences.chinese: 不管怎麼努力，你對過分分享者已永遠改觀。

sentences.english: But you know, again with these new developments,  I'm sure that things will change a bit.
sentences.chinese: 但隨着現在技術的發展，這些事情會有所改觀。

sentences.english: The words of references are used confusedly, and haven't changed for many years.
sentences.chinese: 參考文獻用語使用混亂的狀況多年來沒有改觀。

sentences.english: But sensible, speedy international assistance would make a big difference.
sentences.chinese: 但顯然加速的國際援助將使得一切大爲改觀。

sentences.english: Chapter three doesn't get any better.
Given the faltering economy, it is unlikely that lower-earning Americans have made up ground this year.
sentences.chinese: 鑑於經濟低迷，美國低收入羣體的工資今年難有改觀。

sentences.chinese: 亞磊聞言立即着她別容易對德仕改觀，免得喫虧。

sentences.english: Objective This work was to provide an advanced operation method for square face correction.
sentences.chinese: 目的爲方型臉的改觀提供一種改良術式。

sentences.english: This has changed, through education and advocacy.
sentences.chinese: 通過宣傳教育，現在這方面已經有所改觀。

sentences.english: The new furniture has transfigured the old house.
The face of this city has greatly changed.
sentences.chinese: 這座城市的面貌已大大改觀了。

definition: stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
to shed one's mortal body and exchange one's bones (idiom); born again Daoist/to turn over a new leaf/fig. to change wholly/to create from other material (story, artwork etc)
to improve/to take a turn for the better/improvement
to reverse/to turn around (an undesirable situation)/(mechanics) torsion
